Header: Child dies after falling to lower floor in mall
Summary: Father was carrying two kids during shopping
Detail:
A one-year-old boy died after jumping from his father's lap in a shopping mall and falling to the lower floor.
The police handed over the body to the family after completing legal formalities.
The father of the deceased, Aziz, had gone for shopping along with his family at the shopping mall located on Canal Road.
He was carrying his two children when Abdullah fell from the second to the first floor and was severely injured. A rescue team reached the spot and provided medical aid but the boy succumbed to his injuries.
Madina Town Police handed over the body to the heirs.
Meanwhile, two people including a woman died in traffic accidents, while seven others, including two women and a six-year-old girl, were injured in road traffic crashes. The police shifted the bodies to hospitals and started a search for the drivers responsible for the accidents.
Zuhran Bibi was crossing a road near Nalewala in Chak Jhumra when a speeding car ran over her. She was shifted to a hospital where she succumbed to the injuries.
Meanwhile in Sahyanwala, an unidentified 40-year-old man was hit by an unknown vehicle. As he fell on the road, several vehicles passed over him, due to which he died on the spot.
The police took possession of both the bodies for investigation.
In another accident, Ataullah, Salim, Arshad Bibi, 60 year old Noor Fatima, 40-year-old Halimaan Bibi and Arif were injured near Satyana Road.
Published in The Express Tribune, April 15th, 2024.

Summary: Strong likelihood of reduction in the inflation rate to 12.2 per cent next year
Detail:
Punjab Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz Sharif announced on Sunday that the provincial government had reduced the price of bread to Rs16 per loaf.
In a message on social networking website X, she said the authorities in all districts and the departments concerned of the province had been instructed to ensure strict implementation of the decision.
“May Allah Almighty bring more ease in the lives of people,” the chief minister added.
Meanwhile, Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz paid tribute to Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif over improvement of the country's economic indicators.
She stated that Pakistan's economy has once again started treading on the path of progress. The fruits of economic progress during the tenure of PML-N government are prominently coming to surface. The Chief Minister highlighted, ''The common man would be provided relief with the reduction in electricity rates and price- hike. Big international financial institutions including IMF and ADB highly acknowledge Pakistan's economic policies.'' She said in a statement.
She said there is a strong likelihood of reduction in the inflation rate to 12.2 per cent next year. For the first time, a Rs500 reduction has occurred in the price of a 20kg flour bag and there is a further possibility of Rs300 reduction in the flour price according to market indicators.
Published in The Express Tribune, April 15th, 2024.

Header: Six Noshki attack victims laid to rest
Summary: Men from Mandi Bahauddin were travelling to Iran
Detail:
The funeral prayers for six men who had died in an attack in Noshki on Friday were offered in Chak Fateh Shah, Mandi Bahauddin.
The victims, including Tanzeel, Qasim, Sajid, Abu Bakar and Mazhar were on their way to Iran when they were kidnapped and later killed by armed men.
The victims were in their early 20s and from poor families.
According to local residents, they wanted to go abroad in pursuit of economic opportunities because of poverty.
The bodies were handed over to the families in the presence of Mandi Bahauddin Deputy Commissioner Shahid Imran Marth.
A large number of people, including Gujranwala Commissioner Naveed Haider Shirazi, Mandi Bahauddin District Police Officer Safdar Raza Kazmi and the DC offered funeral prayers.
A companion of the victims, Zahid, who had returned home unharmed, told the media that the armed attackers had forced them to get off a bus and told the driver to drive off.
After the bus moved a few metres ahead, he heard gunshots, he added.
Published in The Express Tribune, April 15th, 2024.
